column4: I have an acer extensa, and ubuntu 9.04 installed on it. It creates a series of short sharp tapping noise everytime any audio file is played. I tried to reinstall it, it went off, but came back again when I installed audacity. I failed to understand the problem. Can anyone help?
Can I get any help herE?
i dont think you will find someone with the same problem. cause audacity doesn change something on the core audio system (pulseaudio). Try to update to the latest ubuntu, thats always the best try
precisely whey i shifted from ubuntu 8.04
I suspect there is a bug somewhere.
there is a new audio system (pulseaudio), which may is the source of your problems.
you can try do deinstall it, but dont expect everthing to run better after that ;)
because it uses a huge amount of overhead instead of the core alsa interface
for legacy application which cant work with pulseaudio directly
fake = emulation. make old application think that they talk to alsa directly (which is not true, cause its first goes to the pulseaudio backend)
:) ah! are you an ubuntu dev?
nope, just someone how does more with music, and so i know the problems of pulseaudio ;)
